intro: Vitaliana primuliflora subf. lepontina, commonly known as the Alpine vitalia, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are oval-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery hair, which helps to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. This subspecies is adapted to rocky and mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, moist conditions.
